content1.title: Dexon Hawk In-line Inspection System (Crack Detection/Sizing and Metal Loss)

subtitle.text: Detection and sizing of cracks and crack-like defects is critical in assessing the integrity and service life of pipelines. By combining exceptional sampling resolution with direct data analysis, the Dexon Hawk ILI system offers highly accurate and detailed inspection results. All individual ultrasonic measurements are saved with raw A-Scan data with up to 1,000,000 measurements recorded per square meter of piping.

Combining this exceptional measurement density with highly accurate data review methods allows for the detection and sizing of irregularly shaped defects such as stress-corrosion cracking, hydrogen induced cracking, heat effected zone cracking, electron resistance weld cracking, fatigue cracking, and others. The Dexon Hawk ILI System tools are highly customizable offering axial angle beam inspection with multiple angles, axial + circumferential + metal loss in a single tool, and multiple transducer frequencies.

sublist.text: Detection of axial and circumferential cracks with through wall propagation of 1.0mm or greater in base material and 1.5 mm or greater in welds
Probability of detection 94% to above sizes
Adjustable circumferential and axial sampling rates
Crack placement with 98% confidence if attached to I.D./O.D.
Simultaneously performs crack inspection and corrosion/metal loss to POF 2016 specifications
Tool customization available for challenging and difficult (unpiggable) pipelines or projects

content3.title: Usage, Detection Capabilities, and Tool Specifications

subtitle.text: Inspection length: up to 200 km (customization available)
Wall thickness range: customizable 4 mm-25 mm
On and offshore, subsea, and above ground pipelines
Oil and gas exploration and production, refineries, petrochemical, mining, and heavy industry
Extreme sampling density of up to 1,000,000 measurements per square meter
Raw A-Scan data recording of all measurements
Automated data analysis and defect detection
Detection and sizing analysis from raw A-Scan data
